snippet: Federal officials said William Barnason, a building superintendent, would try to enter women’s apartments while drunk and demanded sexual favors for rent reductions.
abstract: Upper West Side landlord Stanley Katz and son Stephen Katz, along with former building superintendent William Barnason, agree to pay more than $2 million in fines to tenants who were sexually harassed by Barnason while living in apartment building operated by the trio; United States attorney's office says Stanley Katz knew of complaints filed by tenants against Barnason, a convicted sex offender, but did nothing to stop him.
lead_paragraph: Federal officials said William Barnason, a building superintendent, would try to enter women’s apartments while drunk and demanded sexual favors for rent reductions.

headline.seo: $2 Million Penalty for Sexually Harassing West Side Tenants
headline.main: $2 Million Penalty for Sexually Harassing West Side Tenants
headline.print_headline: $2 Million Penalty for Sexually Harassing West Side Tenants
